lines.text: This isn't a school! It's a bear pit! The most disgusting shambles I've ever seen! I'm resigning, do you hear me? As of now!
Good!
Captain Lancaster, I thought I made it crystal clear when I appointed you that I will not tolerate any form of corporal punishment in my school!
I was perfectly within my rights. The boys were cheating.
Oh, were they indeed?
[goes from his office to the classroom]
Danny, Sid...
[they come to him]
The rest of you, sit down, sit down. Try to be good.
[shuts the door]
Now, on your word of honor, were either of you two cheating just now?
[Captain Lancaster looks on derisively]
No sir.
And you?
No sir.
Good. Back to class.
[the boys leave]
Captain Lancaster, if I catch you using the cane ever again in my school, you'll be out on your ear. Is that understood?
[Lancaster refuses to answer]
Is that understood, sir?

[through his teeth]
Yes, sir.
Good, sir!
I should warn you, I always get what I want!
No one can have EVERYTHING they want.
I'm warning you, Smith - you trespass on my land again, you're gonna get shot!
Who the devil do you think you are? Just because you've got a bit of money, you think you have the right to...
Shut up, will you! D'you hear me, Smith?
At the moment, Mr. Hazell, you are on MY land. You have one minute to get off it.
I'm certainly not staying out here all night on the wages I get paid!

[it starts raining]
I'm getting wet, Rabbetts!
You're right, I should have sent him to school earlier. But, you see... my wife died when he was four months old.
[nods toward her picture on the wall, and adds quietly]
He was all I had.

[sympathetically, looking at the picture]
A fine-looking girl.
Well, I'm convinced. And I can assure you, you won't be hearin' any more from the council. Danny, you're a lucky boy - you've got the most spiffin' father!

[as they are served punch cups]
What the devil does Hazell think this is, a wedding?
I suppose he thinks its traditional.

[incredulous]
Traditional? Punch at a shoot?
[last lines]
God bless you, Danny Boy!
